company_overview: Sr. Manager, Data Science                    Thermo Fisher Scientific                                  Field Pointe, MD              Remote                1 week ago                                    2 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Biotechnology Research100 school alumniSee recent hiring trends for Thermo Fisher Scientific. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Sr. Manager, Data Science at Thermo Fisher Scientific
Title: Sr. Manager, Data Science
JD:
About the job
    


          Position Summary:
When you're part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer. We are looking for a Sr. Manager, Data Science to join our team!
How will you make an impact?
The NA Marketing Science is an innovative team focused on data intelligence, technology and measurement to drive revenue and improve our positioning while delivering a best-in-class customer experience. Your team will drive profitably by improving customer experience through sophisticated models and customer segments aimed at improving relevancy and personalization. You will lead a team of innovative Data Scientists and Analysts who develop solutions for a broad range of business functions. This position will scale our capability to analytically draw upon customer data and create workflows that deliver relevant messaging in multiple channels. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of business and technical skills that will be applied to achieve personalization goals together with key counterparts including Marketing, Sales, Data Engineering and IT.
A day in the life:
Attract, retain and develop a unique team of Data Scientists focused on modeling and audience segmentationLead cross-functional relationships with Product Managers, IT, Marketing and Engineers to enable a data-first culture and elevate predictive modeling into business strategyInfluence business prioritization by finding opportunities to use data science solutions and elevate recommendations to all levels of leadershipDevelop strategies to reach contacts through multiple marketing channels including onsite merchandising, email, social and 3rd party channelsLead multi-year vision of data health and cleanliness which with a cross-function, multi-sourced database. Prioritize required initiatives with IT and Data ArchitectsUnderstands business objectives and translates requirements into audience and data science modeling roadmap itemsLead Data Scientists to develop and interpret targeted customer and prospect profiles applying statistical methodologies as well as models and segmentation schemes to develop recommendationsCollaboration with other Data Science teams across the organization and the Corporate Center of Excellence to lead high level strategy & roadmap optimizationLead existing vendor relationships and evaluate new vendors to provide 3rd party data for data augmentation and enrichment.Liaison between Data Science team and IT resources such as Data Engineers and Data Stewards
Keys to Success:
Experience leading team that applies their diverse skills and perspective to achieve a common goalDemonstrated expertise in predictive modeling, data mining and data analysisProficient with SQL, SAS, IBM, Python, Databricks or similar data collaboration platformsAbility to translate modeling output to key business insightsDigitally savvy, with exceptional analytical, quantitative, problem-solving, and critical thinking skillsStrong ability to organize, analyze, interpret, and disseminate information.Ability to make decisions, prioritize and lead multiple projects in a fast- paced, dynamic environment.
Non-Negotiable Requirements:
MBA or Master’s in Analytics, Economics or Data Science 8+ years of experience with sophisticated segmentation tools, statistical modeling, data architecture or similarExperience with Query language and Campaign Management Tools (IBM Unica Campaign, Adobe Audience Manager)Experience with in- market application of segmentation schemes, demographic data, and predictive modeling.
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
Accessibility/Disability Access
Thermo Fisher Scientific offers accessibility service for job seekers requiring accommodations. For example, this may include individuals requiring assistance because of hearing, vision, mobility, or cognitive impairments. If you are a job seeker, or assisting a person with a disability, and require accessibility assistance or an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please submit a request by telephone at 1-855-471-2255*. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.

company_overview: Data Analyst *Hybrid Role*                    Thermo Fisher Scientific                                  Pittsburgh, PA              On-site                2 weeks ago                                    34 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Biotechnology Research100 school alumniSee how you compare to 34 applicants. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Data Analyst *Hybrid Role* at Thermo Fisher Scientific
Title: Data Analyst *Hybrid Role*
JD:
About the job
    


          Come Grow Your Career With Thermo Fisher Scientific!
* Hybrid role reporting to our Pittsburgh location*
Thermo Fisher Scientific is the global leader in serving science. Ranked #92 on the 2022 Fortune 500 list and with revenues of more than $40 billion, you’ll discover opportunities to grow an exciting career with an industry leader. When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
How will you make an impact?
This new position, Data Governance Analyst for Customer Channels Group (CCG) plays a vital role in protecting a key asset of Thermo Fisher Scientific: the Data. This individual would partner with application and data owners and the business to ensure data governance needs are being met.
In partnership with CCG’s business and IT divisions, the Data Governance Analyst will be passionate about ensuring data is cataloged and data definitions, lineage, owners, rules, etc are detailed, and data quality standards are being met to enable data consumers accurate and rapid access to clean, consistent, meaningful data for agile analytics and development needs.
Successful candidates must have superb communication and prioritization skills and be diligent.
What will you do?
Build relationships with data owners and data stewards within CCG to understand their data needsDocument data governance requirements defined by data owners and stewards within the data governance tool (including security requirements, calculations, definitions, cleansing rules)Communicate data needs to the data delivery team and ensure accuracy of final productContinuously supervise data for compliance with standards and quality rulesUnderstand and document data lineage within data governance toolAssist data consumers with data sourcing requirements and questionsPerform training on data governance tool
How will you get here?
Required Skills:
Excellent critical thinking, problem solving, analytical, and communication skillsData-driven mentality, self-motivated, responsible, diligent, and detail orientedProficiencies with SQL, data warehousing, data lakes, data analytics, big data technologies, and relational databasesDesire to learn and improve processes to allow for agilityUnderstanding of data governance methodologies and frameworksExperience with Alation and Snowflake a plus
Education/Experience Level:
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field (Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, etc.)1+ years of experience in data governance, data management, data warehousing, business intelligence, development, architecture, data engineering, Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS), or similar roleSolid understanding of AWS or other cloud-based data offerings
Are you ready to join an inclusive, positive, and lively team?
Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

company_overview: Data Analyst II                    Thermo Fisher Scientific                                  Grand Island, NY              On-site                1 week ago                                    31 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Biotechnology Research100 school alumniSee how you compare to 31 applicants. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Data Analyst II at Thermo Fisher Scientific
Title: Data Analyst II
JD:
About the job
    


          As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer!
Position Title:  Data Analyst II
What will you do?
Responsible for establishing product master data management capabilities to include the development of data standards, reports, monthly audit meetings with each function, business process improvement and monthly data governance meetings.
Specific ResponsibilitiesPartner with data owners to develop data standards for critical data attributesInterrogate product data with reference to data standards to identify data defectsA data defect is an instance where the value of an attribute is blank, inconsistent with the data standard or there are discrepancies between systemsDevelop leading KPIs that proactively prevent product master data from causing customer issuesPartner with data owners on a monthly basis to distribute monthly data quality reports, audit the health of the data and drive data clean-up where product data is not in compliance with data standardReports should advise the leaders which data owners are adhering to service level agreements and performing consistent and comprehensive data quality auditsDevelop capability to systematically compare product data across systems and identify discrepanciesEngage with business owners (functions) who own data on the product to create cross-business processes for creating, changing and discontinuing products in a way that keeps the product data in-sync across all applicable ERP systemsFunctions include manufacturing, planning, procurements, quality, regulatory affairs, costing, pricingContribute to value stream mapping sessions across relevant ERP systems to identify process gaps that lead to customer order issues or reworkProcesses include product creation, change and discontinuationSupport monthly data governance meetings to report on data health, discuss process gaps, status of process improvement opportunities, decide on proposed changes to process or data ownership, escalate issues or requests for support from other functions to leadership as neededDevelop service level agreements with business data owners that determine auditing frequency, turn-around-time, data correction across businesses and systemsContribute to Kaizens, Just Do Its, Root Cause Counter Measures to close process and data gaps across businesses and systemsSupport Daily Accountability mechanisms that drive visibility to issues, causes and corrective actions with appropriate escalations (e.g. Tier Boards) that are inputs into existing mechanisms with leaders (e.g. Ops Leader)
Qualifications
Education, Experience:
BS degree in business, systems, or data science requiredMinimum 1-3 years data analysis experience
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Possess high levels of data accuracy and attention to detailStrong analytical skills, combined with practical business knowledgeStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to form relationships across various functional disciplinesProficient in MS Office, Outlook, Excel (V-Lookup, Pivot Tables, Formulas, Charts)Possess strong applied technical knowledge of Word, Access, and ProjectFamiliar with master data structures and ERP systemsFamiliar with principles of product lifecycle managementKnowledgeable about Key Performance Indicators
Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. As one global team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need.
Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Try Premium for free Your profile matches this job     Apply         Save            Save Thermo Fisher Scientific, Data Science intern - Application via WayUp at WayUp
Title: Thermo Fisher Scientific, Data Science intern - Application via WayUp
JD:
About the job
    


          This role is with Thermo Fisher Scientific. WayUp is partnering with Thermo Fisher Scientific to hire top talent.
As a Data Science Intern, you will be part of a team dedicated to increasing business efficiency of a Fortune 200 Company. This position provides an exciting way for a rising student passionate about Data Science to employ a cross section of machine learning and analytic processes to develop algorithms that will improve efficiency and drive revenue. You will quickly grasp the complex business priorities and marketing objectives to create value for the broader Data Science program. Key Responsibilities: 
Leverage existing skills in Python to automate existing business processesParticipate in daily stand ups to understand how to work in an agile mannerDevelop methods to translate customer contacts to existing data tables for use in model outputProactively identify opportunities for new data uses to generate leads and drive revenueEffectively respond to ad hoc analyses Minimum Requirements: Rising Junior studying Data Science, Analytics or similar degreeExperience in SAS, SQL Server, Oracle and Python is helpfulFamiliarity with available Open Source solutions to boost effectiveness Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: Comfortable extracting data from multiple sources, cleaning and validating for duplicates and other anomaliesEmploying math and statistics into algorithmsProject management skills and the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects to execute responsibilities in a timely mannerMust embrace team spirit and have strong interpersonal skillsExcellent written and oral communications
